maml:description.maml:para: Get a test case.

Gets all functional test cases included in a test suite or retrieves a specific test case by its ID. By adding the `-IncludeRecentlyDeleted` switch parameter when retrieving all, the list can also include test cases deleted within the last 30 days, which you can restore.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Includes items deleted within the last 30 days, which you can restore.
Returns test cases with resolved variables assigned statically.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Identifies a functional test case.
Identifies a test suite.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Includes items deleted within the last 30 days, which you can restore.
Returns test cases with resolved variables assigned statically.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Identifies a functional test case.
Identifies a test suite.

Includes items deleted within the last 30 days, which you can restore.

Unique identifier for property associated with the test suite to filter the list by. You can combine this parameter with `propertyVersion`. Use either this parameter or `propertyName` to specify the property.
Property name associated with a test suite to filter the list by. You can combine this parameter with `propertyVersion`. Use either this parameter or `propertyId` to specify the property.
Version of the associated Property Manager property to filter the test suites by. Combine this parameter with `propertyId` or `propertyName`.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Filters the list to items created, edited, or deleted by a specific username.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Include child objects such as test cases and variables in the result.
Includes items deleted within the last 30 days, which you can restore.

Version of the associated Property Manager property to filter the test suites by. Combine this parameter with `propertyId` or `propertyName`.
Returns test cases with resolved variables assigned statically.

Identifies a test suite.

Add test cases to a test suite.

Adds a list of new functional test cases to a test suite. Each test case consists of a test request, client profile, and condition. If you want to use variables within a condition or test request's URL or request header, run the `New-TestVariable` operation first.
Identifies a test suite.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Return response metadata as well as the usual 'successes' object.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.

Return response metadata as well as the usual 'successes' object.

Identifies a test suite.
Submit a test run.
Submits a test run for functional testing. With one request you can run the test for a property version, test suite, and functional test case.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Create a test suite.

Creates a new test suite. When running this operation, you can optionally auto-generate the child objects with the `-AutoGenerate` switch parameter. > Note: Your request body will be parsed to check fo the presence of test cases or variables, and will be routed to the correct endpoint appropriately.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

Generates a default test suite with test cases and variables for a specific property version and a URL. Based on property settings and its behaviors and the URL, Test Center generates a default test suite object with test cases and variables.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

Generates a default test suite with test cases and variables for a specific property version and a URL. Based on property settings and its behaviors and the URL, Test Center generates a default test suite object with test cases and variables.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Add variables to a test suite.
Adds new variables to a test suite. You can use variables in a test request's URL or request headers and in condition expression, as a substitute of placeholders.
Identifies a test suite.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Return response metadata as well as the usual 'successes' object.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Identifies a test suite.

Removes functional test cases with specific identifiers from a test suite. To get the identifiers, run the `Get-TestCase` operation.

Delete a test suite.
Deletes a test suite and the included child objects, such as test cases and variables. You can restore test suites within 30 days of deleting them by running the `Restore-TestSuite` operation.
Identifies a test suite.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Restore test cases.

Restores functional test cases into a test suite. To get the ID of the test case you want to restore, run the `Get-TestCase` operation with the `-IncludeRecentlyDeleted` switch parameter. With this operation, you can restore only those test cases that were deleted no later than 30 days from their deletion date.
Identifies a test suite.
Identifies a functional test case.

EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Identifies a test suite.
Restore a test suite.
Restores a deleted test suite and the included child objects. With this operation, you can restore only those test suits that were deleted no later than 30 days from their deletion date.
Identifies a test suite.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Identifies a test suite.
Update test cases.

Updates functional test cases in a test suite. > Note: Due to the complexity of the request body, it's recommended you retrieve the existing test case with the `Get-TestCase` operation, edit it locally, and pipe the object to this function.
Identifies a test suite.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.

Identifies a test suite.
Reorder test cases in a test suite.

Reorders functional test cases in a test suite. The order of test cases applies when running a test for stateful test suites. You need to provide the target order for all test cases included in a test suite. To check the current order of test cases, run the `Get-TestSuite` operation.
Identifies a test suite.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.
